name: Monopoly - "I Love Lucy" Style! Quiz | Hobbies | 15 Questions

questions.text: In the original Monopoly, the dice are white with black dots. What colours are they in this version?
questions.explanation:
Pink with white dots.

	The board, box, and dice are mainly pink, white, and red.

questions.text: In the original Monopoly, you'd buy "Utilities". In "I Love Lucy" Monopoly, you'd buy:
questions.explanation:
Sports Outings.

	Instead of the "Electric Company" and "Water Works", you can buy "Lucy and Bob Hope", and "The Golf Game".

questions.text: In the original Monopoly, you'd buy "Railroads". In "I Love Lucy" Monopoly, you'd buy what?
questions.explanation:
Trips.

	The "Railroads" are replaced with "Second Honeymoon", "Bon Voyage", "California, Here We Come!", and "Return Home from Europe".

questions.text: In the original Monopoly, you'd pick up a "Chance" card. In "I Love Lucy" Monopoly, you'd get a what?
questions.explanation:
Ricardos Card.

	Each Ricardos card has a picture of either Ricky or Lucy on it.

questions.text: In the original Monopoly, you'd pick up a "Community Chest" card. In "I Love Lucy" Monopoly, you'd pick up a what?
questions.explanation:
Mertzes Card.

	Each Mertzes card has a picture of either Ethel or Fred on it.

questions.text: How many tokens, or playing pieces, are there?
questions.explanation:
6.

	Instead of being an iron or a top hat, you can be a "Vitameatavegamin" bottle, Ricky's conga drum, Ricky's hat, a Cadillac convertible, a wine press, or a loving cup.

questions.text: The picture of Ricky, Lucy, Fred, and Ethel, in the centre of the game board, is from which episode of "I Love Lucy"?
questions.explanation:
"California, Here We Come!".

	This same cheery picture is on all of the money, as well.

questions.text: In the original Monopoly, you'd pay a luxury tax. In "I Love Lucy" Monopoly, you'd pay for what?
questions.explanation:
A Night at the Tropicana.

	On this square, there is a picture of Ricky with his hat in one hand, performing a number at his nightclub.

questions.text: In the original Monopoly, you'd pay income tax. In "I Love Lucy" Monopoly, you'd pay for which of these?
questions.explanation:
New Furniture.

	This square shows a picture of Lucy sitting in an old, somewhat dilapidated rocking chair.

questions.text: The four corner squares in "I Love Lucy" Monopoly are the same as the ones in the original Monopoly.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The four corner squares ("Go", "Jail", "Free Parking", and "Go to Jail") stay the same.

questions.text: The rent, house, and hotel prices stay the same.
questions.explanation:
False.

	In the original Monopoly, you might have the "Baltic" and "Mediterranean Avenue" set. If you have hotels on these, and someone lands on "Baltic", she would have to pay you $450. However, in "I Love Lucy" Monopoly, you only have to pay $250 for landing on "Baltic Avenue", or "Lucy is Enceinte", as it's called in Lucy Monopoly.

questions.text: In the original Monopoly, you might take a walk on the "Boardwalk". In "I Love Lucy" Monopoly, what would you walk on?
questions.explanation:
"Lucy Does a TV Commercial".

	"Job Switching" replaces Park Place, "Off to Florida" replaces "Marvin Gardens", and "The Million Dollar Idea" replaces "Illinois Avenue".

questions.text: In the original Monopoly, you might pick up a "Chance" card and get an advance token to "Illinois" Avenue. In "I Love Lucy" Monopoly, you might have an advance token to what episode?
questions.explanation:
"The Million Dollar Idea".

	"Lucy is Envious" replaces "St. Charles Place".

questions.text: In the original Monopoly you might pick up a "Community Chest" card and get an advance token to "St. Charles Place". What would you get an advance token to in this version?
questions.explanation:
"Lucy is Envious".

	"Lucy and Bob Hope" replaces one of the "Utilities", the "Electric Company".

questions.text: One of the episodes you can buy in "I Love Lucy" Monopoly is "Lucy is Jealous of Girl Singer".
questions.explanation:
False.

	You can only buy twenty-eight different episodes, and this isn't one of them. Thanks a lot for playing my quiz. "I Love Lucy" forever!
